website_summaries.verdict: The Nikon D5300 is a great choice as a general-purpose dSLR.
pros: Excellent photo quality, a great feature set, and speedy performance put the Nikon D5300 ahead of the pack
cons: The default settings could be better and Live View is still really slow to use

customer_reviews.title: Gray market import with no warranty in the US
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy from this seller - you'll get a camera, but it is a chinese market model with no warranty in the USA. Nikon USA will not touch it. We received a camera and it never worked right. It didn't shoot as well as our 10yo D5000 - sent in for repair and Nikon sent it righ back, wouldn't touch it. Wonder if it's counterfeit...
customer_reviews.author: Karl A

customer_reviews.title: 24.2 MP
customer_reviews.text: This is my third "D" series Nikon, D5000, D5100 & now D5300. With 24.2 MP and a 300mm lens I can enlarge the image to a size in excess of a 1500mm lens and still have a reasonably crisp on-screen image. This model also has GPS. I have not tried it yet so can't testify to its functionality. Each one of these cameras has brought improvements over the the previous models and especially this '5300. My focus is on wildlife photography and it's as demanding of perfection as any other field of photography. I do confess that my camera exceeds my own skills - happily );-).
customer_reviews.author: Paul S.

customer_reviews.title: Only Grey Market Cameras left, excellent photos.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is excellent. All the other reviews are accurate. Please be aware that they no longer offer the USA version of this camera, only the international, and that sellers are still offering it under this listing. Grey market cameras can not be repaired by and will not have a warranty through Nikon USA. The seller did offer a 1 year complementary warranty on the item, however at purchase I was not aware that this camera would be grey market.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my first SLR, and after much research, I decided on this mid-range Nikon. Great for someone teaching themselves photography, because it gives you the option to adjust all the individual settings like a pro, but also has fantastic quality pictures on the automatically selectable settings based on what kind of picture you're taking (portrait, outdoors, etc). We've been thrilled with the quality of both the pictures of family, as well as some nature photography. If all you want to do is point and shoot, the entry level SLRs are probably a smarter choice, but if you want to learn some more complex photography and have more setting options, this is an excellent choice.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B.

customer_reviews.title: I dont know what i am doing, but I love it
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea what i am doing with this, but it works. i think i need a different lens because i am recording people 5ft away. this has a phone app that allows you slightly focus it from infront by taking pictures, but thats just to fine tune. biggest drawback of other cameras is that they overheat. I can record for about 1.5hrs in 1080p 60fps before overheating. my previous nikon j1 camera would only last about 30-45 mins
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: They said it was used, but you'd never know it.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Nikon D3100 and was looking to upgrade. I settled upon the D5300 and started looking around. To save some bucks, I took a chance on one listed as "Used - very good" by seller Replay Tech and I've been very pleased. The camera body was in pristine condition and it has functioned perfectly in the 2 months I've had it. My only issue I have is that the kit lens that came with it is average at best, but I had bought a separate lens so I don't use it much. The camera itself is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: billm3727

customer_reviews.title: Built-in microphones defective
customer_reviews.text: We wondered about the lower price point and discovered finally what the defect is: The built-in microphones don't work. When you record video through them, all you get for audio is a clicking noise. Fortunately, audio quality is fine when you use a plug-in mic. It's not all that much of an issue. If you're buying a camera for video capability, it isn't a Nikon anyway. This is a great still camera. I carry it everywhere I go, with the 18-140 lens, and it gets great images in both point-and-shoot and program modes.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy for the wifi capabilities
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera a little over a year ago as a certified pre-owned camera and have enjoyed it. I'm just digging into all the features like the wifi capability. The wifi does not work!!! I tried this so many times and the camera just continues to say "waiting for connection", while my phone says "connected". I have a Samsung Galaxy 8.
customer_reviews.author: fireflies

customer_reviews.title: Typical high Nikon quality
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a fan of Nikon since I bought my Photomic FTn in 1970. I still have it. I’m an amateur who has had the photography bug since I was a teenager. This is a step up from my D3100, which I also still own. It’s an improvement in every way, easy to use, high quality. It also has a hinged viewfinder which offers unique flexibility. So far I’ve been very happy with it. I anticipate many years of service.
customer_reviews.author: Tony 0625

customer_reviews.title: A real Nikon winner!
customer_reviews.text: I have five Nikon cameras. One pro and the rest at the high end amateur. This is a great little camera that has all the bells and whistles for a novice photographer that wants to become serious about their photography. Everyone has given you the pros and cons so I will not bore you with all of that. I will just tell you that if you put a great Nikon lens on this little body you will have superb results. I have not been disappointed at all! I have shot engagement photos, landscape and my grand-kids playing football (action) and I don't have any disappointing shots! Nikon does it once again!
customer_reviews.author: Jane E. Russell

customer_reviews.title: "Best Seller Deals" shame on you for selling Gray Market Cameras
customer_reviews.text: "Best Seller Deals" shame on you for selling a Gray Market Cameras, Any warranty work will cost you extra money to send this back to Asia for repair, good grief. Do you really think people won't be alarmed by the European battery charger plug?
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Wi-Fi is awesome to share your photos right after taking them
customer_reviews.text: It takes Sharp photos indeed, I had a D90 prior to this camera. In comparison to D90 with 18-200mm zoom lens, the pictures with D5300 (18-55mm or even 50-300mm) are way sharper and I guess that's all I need for now. Wi-Fi is awesome to share your photos right after taking them. GPS is not something that I need but it works fine. Videos are more than awesome! I highly recommend this over D5500 for the sake of money and D7000 for the sake of back focus problems.
customer_reviews.author: Sina S.

customer_reviews.title: Package arrived on time. The package seal was broken ...
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived on time. The package seal was broken. And, upon inspection I learn that the camera is the India/Australia (gray market) version. I looked everywhere in the description for this notation. Could not find it. Thinking of sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Kaks

customer_reviews.title: Best camera I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best camera I have ever owned! Wifi, GPS, beast mode on battery consumption (they last forever!) The camera takes amazing pictures assuming you have amazing lenses and the required knowledge/skills to accompany it. Highly recommend this as a mid-level camera body. Great family camera if you are in the market for a body and already have Nikon lenses. That was my situation and I have zero regrets in buying this... Thanks NIKON for making a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Cronin

customer_reviews.title: This is a body for sale in China only - GPS is disabled
customer_reviews.text: This is a body for sale in China only - GPS is disabled. Location data option will be grayed out. This seller is a total scam. The 800 reviews are for a different camera.
customer_reviews.author: Tom L.

customer_reviews.title: A huge upgrade D40x -> D5300
customer_reviews.text: Made the jump from an old Nikon D40x to this D5300 and WOW! It is familiar enough to be comfortable flipping through the menus, but my goodness how those menus have grown! Built in Wifi is fantastic and linked right up to my iphone. I am really enjoying getting to know my way around this camera and am very happy with the quality of pics I am able to attain. I loved my D40x, it gave me 10+ years of great use, but everything about this camera is slightly to much better. I hope my daughter has as much fun with the D40x as I am with the D5300.
customer_reviews.author: funkermudgeon

customer_reviews.title: Solid Work from Nikon
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Nikon after upgrading from the D3100. I really, really like this camera, and actually chose it over the D5500, due to the fact that I did not want a touch screen (would save battery). It's a great upper-intermediate camera, but I wish I would've splurged on the D7100 due to the fact that it is weather sealed and this is not. Four stars only because I have had it freeze up on a couple of occasions, but other than that, I'm sticking with this camera for a while!
customer_reviews.author: J. Dehne

customer_reviews.title: Great DSLR for getting into photography
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great camera set to get into DSLR photography. Much easier to navigate the menus/settings on this body than the professional models. The included lens is good for general use but will quickly show its limits if you start down the rabbit hole of photography. The 'for dummies book for this camera is very helpful and will get you running this body efficiently quickly. Battery life has been great for common use. 100+ pics over 5 hours has only drained the battery to 70% even with use of the native flash.
customer_reviews.author: Lawson Barfield

customer_reviews.title: Grey Market!
customer_reviews.text: Beware! Although the fine print at the bottom of the amazon add shows a NIKON USA warranty, the camera I received had no warranty card and no manual. I want a USA warranty product. Amazon should at least police their prime offerings better.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Stivers

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Upgrade from an Exhausted D3200 (160,000 actuations). Flippy LCD is Robust, and unless you beat the crap out of your camera, its actually nice because you can hide the LCD upside down preventing damage (if you are a brute). Low light noise is fantastic, and even while using an ND filter, I have yet to see much in the way of noise. Attached is the first shot i took with the camera with no editing at all. (D5300 - Tokina 11-16mm 2.8, ND 4+ND8 4min Exposure JPEG sent via WIFI to Android) Got the insurance as the plastic body on my D3200 suffered a crack that was pretty frightening.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Need a DSLR on a budget!?!  Get this one!  Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Camera works great. No complaints. Does everything it was built to do. Quality is good. Nothing feels cheap or loose on this camera. I love my Nikons as this is my 5th one. I got this one on a budget and have not been disappointed. Lenses and accessories are easy to find on Amazon. If you want to get into DSLR's cheaper than the ones the pro's use, I'd recommend this one!
customer_reviews.author: Yancy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! I've had it for about half a year now, and it works perfectly for the style of pictures I take. It takes high quality photos without a $2,000+ price tag, and there are a lot of different lenses you can get to experiment with different styles. I would absolutely recommend it to beginners or intermediate photographers who are on a budget. I attached some photos I've taken as examples of how I'm using it. I have a Tamron 70-300 macro lens, and a Micro-NIKKOR 40 mm f/2.8G I use quite often.
customer_reviews.author: Knoots

customer_reviews.title: awesome camera!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to take on my honeymoon and paired it with a Sigma 17-70mm lens (thats all I took!). I got many fantastic shots, and now my family wants me to take pictures of all of our yearly meet-ups. Overall this camera is great, it has a ton of advanced features and takes beautiful pictures - in both manual and automatic mode. I wish it had native panorama built in, and the Nikon iPhone app wasn't so clunky. In summary, though I drool over full frame cameras, this will serve me well for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: SNayak

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera!
customer_reviews.text: I just upgraded from the D3100, which I had for 4 years, and I am amazed by the difference in quality. There's a lot of bells and whistles on the camera, but since I'm familiar with the Nikon menus, it's not too intimidating. If you're a beginner, I strongly recommend getting one of the many D5300 guides available. Also, all my lenses from the D3100 work on this camera, as well as the batteries. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: SK480

customer_reviews.title: It's a nikon SLR. It does the job.
customer_reviews.text: This feels a little cheaper than the d5200, but only because it's lighter, i guess. I bought this because the screen broke on the D5200, and replacing the screen was only about $100 cheaper than this camera. So there you go. Fits all lenses we already have, it's a nikon. battery life seems fine.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rood

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: Ah! I love this camera! This is my first camera like this and I am so glad I went with this model. I'm an amateur photographer who does landscape/nature shots. I played with it the day I got it and it was so easy to use! I took it off point and shoot, and tried the A mode- I love it! By far the best purchase I've made on amazon yet! So worth it! Can't wait to continue to take such stunning pictures!
customer_reviews.author: IowaKay

customer_reviews.title: The first thing I like is the feel of the camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Nikon, I always alternate between canon and Nikon. The first thing I like is the feel of the camera. It's light, but don't let that fool you. It's loaded with features. It's going to take me a while to figure it all out...the manual settings that is. I've always been lazy and used the auto settings; but with this camera....going to learn by trial and error. I definitely like the burgundy red color. It's a change from the common black; not to mention, it's an eye catcher. I purchased the almost 400 dollar 300mm lens. It is definitely powerful and can't wait to use it taking photos in manhatten. I think it's well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: CHILL

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight DSLR camera for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for a friend who loves photography but does want the bother of playing with shutter, aperture or ISO settings. The camera is very lightweight, has a gorgeous display, a fully articulating screen. It takes great photos and video every bit as good as my D7000, perhaps better. The noise characteristics are maybe even better than the D7000 and has more pixels to boot! As soon as you want to start changing aperture settings shutter speeds, AF or quickly need to change ISO then you might find the camera frustrating as you sometimes will have to navigate the software on the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Check It Out Before Ordering Online
customer_reviews.text: It takes great photos. I really like the software and wifi features. The small body size, buttons and controls are tough for larger hands and fingers. If you're considering this camera w/ the 18-140mm lens package, go to your local retailer and check it out. It might not fit your grip and unique finger dexterity. Check out the equivalent other brands for size and button locations. It might sway you towards the Canon lineup. I really like the Nikon system and was willing to move up to the 5300 after using Pentax, Canon and Olympus products. YMMV.
customer_reviews.author: Tpr. Joe

customer_reviews.title: Okay but low light not so much
customer_reviews.text: Not overly fond of this camera body. Images are always on the darker side. Decent starter dslr. I was teying to upgrade from the D3300 however I feel this was not a good choice. Does not perform well enough in low light for me even with a 50mm 1.8 lens. Struggles in low light to autofocus. Wifi works well. No issues there. If you are experienced with using a dslr and are upgrading, this is not the best choice. Good beginner camera.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Makes the Grade!
customer_reviews.text: An excellent camera! Good for beginners or advanced users. Easy to operate. My only complaint, I haven't had this camera for long, is the USB cable for downloading photographs from the camera to a computer. It is only about one foot long! I bought another for $8 that is 5' long. Nikon makes a wonderful camera and gets skimpy on the length of the USB cable. Aside from that, the camera is fantastic at 24 mp. The attached photo I made with Tamron 90mm Macro lens, manual, and the camera's macro setting.
customer_reviews.author: hereticzero

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A good camera for what I do. Autofocus is not as good as I hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Keith L. Olsen

customer_reviews.title: High Quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd Nikon I have owned. I love the quality and ease of use. I was able to unbox and immediately take pictures. The shipping was fast and great quality as well. I am beyond pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Big old sensor. Hard to find a sensor of its size even in a more expensive camera. Great user interface design both in manual controls and digital menus. Kit lens has a pretty great range if range is what you're looking for. One big beef: Almost everything else on this camera comes close to or surpasses the nearest professional cameras up the ladder, so why hold back on the viewfinder coverage? Witholding one star because I should be able to get the shot I aim for without switching to liveview or cropping in postprocess.
customer_reviews.author: eyetrieditathome

customer_reviews.title: D5300 with 18-140 lens
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with everything but the GPS. I even downloaded the location file. I am yet to get ONE picture with location information. If this is your reason for buying, don't! Maybe Nikon will provide a firmware update that fixes this issue. Wirelessly sending pictures to PCs and smart phones is not as good as it sounds. Read the advert/spec carefully. It would be nice if the camera had an automatic power off (if it does, I have not found it as yet).
customer_reviews.author: Curtis G. Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Image quality is exceptional. Body is very light and small. Many pro(ish) reviewers complain about missing buttons saying that with buttons they can control settings without taking it out of their face. What kind of extreme situation should it be that you don't have time to take it off? You must shoot a sporting event of extreme importance. If you rarely do it (if at all) then you are perfectly fine. It will serve you well in 99% of situations even with manual settings.
customer_reviews.author: Igor Sorokin

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: Handy, I'm a septuagenarian who tried a D7000 and found it to heavy and bulky for me the D5300 seems just right and I love the way it feels. I chose the red which draws attention but the cameras high quality and small size supersedes distractions that might produce. I love this device!
customer_reviews.author: BamaRose

customer_reviews.title: Not What I Expected
customer_reviews.text: What I received is not what is pictured. I wanted a camera for manual use. I put in on Manual Mode, but it kept auto-focusing. After Googling how to focus in manual, I discovered my lens does NOT look like the lens pictured in the product photo. My lens has no Auto or Manual switch. Useless to me. Will need to return.
customer_reviews.author: Debra J.

customer_reviews.title: Item is not accurate with description.
customer_reviews.text: I did not received Nikon D5300 what I paid for, instead I received Nikon D3400. Refund my money please.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great choice
customer_reviews.text: All my camera gear bag, lenses were destroyed in a serious car crash over Thanksgiving weekend. I had a D5200 and was happy with it. I decided to replace it with this D 5300. I am extremely pleased with this replacement. This model is equipped with built in wi fi, all of the other non professional DSLR Nikon models do not have built in wi fi, this was a deciding factor. I am very pleased with my new Nikon and I love the versitility of the lens. I have shot with Nikon for over 35 years and very happy with this recent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Egretta

customer_reviews.title: Just what I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this camera for about three months and love it! Still learning the complexities of DSLR, as my last SLR experience is pretty dated. Camera is fantastic in the auto modes. Video is crisp. Would recommend getting the biggest SD capacity with the fastest transfer rate you can afford if you are taking video. At full HD resolution a ten minute video is about a GB. Sound recording is excellent in video mode. Am going to get the Nikon boom mike to further improve.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan R. Putney

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera! It has tons of features and takes fantastic, high resolution pictures. I opted to get the 55-300 telephoto lens at the same time to expand the range. The camera is super easy to use for beginners but has also offers full range of controls for when you are comfortable and ready to try advanced settings and techniques. Very flexible, very intuitive. I especially like the large display screen. I'm having a great time trying new things and expanding my photography skills! :)
customer_reviews.author: JJones

customer_reviews.title: ... waited to write this review but this camera is awesome. I'm below a novice of a photographer but ...
customer_reviews.text: I should have probably waited to write this review but this camera is awesome. I'm below a novice of a photographer but the manual focus and the features are a joy to play with. Seeing pics people were able to achieve with this sensor has inspired me to buy a few books. It's been voted best beginner DSLR of 2015 by CNET or something or other. You won't be disappointed though expect to buy a tripod and more lenses in the coming months.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir G.

customer_reviews.title: Takes great pictures - no need to upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! It is fairly light weight and has lots of great features. I use it for family photos as well as product pictures for work. I will continue to buy accessories for this camera - I'm feeling no need to upgrade to a fancier one. This camera does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Loving my D5300
customer_reviews.text: This camera is as advertised given that it was a hard decision for me going with this choice given all the other choices out there, at first. However, once received I am completely satisfied with my decision. The performance on this product is outstanding. For an example, I have been a point and shoot photographer for a long period of time with the Nikon D5100. However, the interfaces built on this camera I found unique and making it easier elevating my photography to another level.
customer_reviews.author: ROLL TIDE

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, but I returned it. I decided to step up to FX and bought a Canon 6D instead. Nothing wrong with the D5300 though. I really liked it for the few days I had it. Actually, the D5300's WIFI influenced my decision to buy the Canon 6D, which also has WIFI. I love the ability to download certain photos wirelessly. My daughters use Facebook & Instagram and they always ask me to take certain pictures so they can instantly download them to their I-Phones. Very cool! The WIFI worked really well on my I-Phone 4. Nikon makes a great product, as usual.
customer_reviews.author: TamandAl

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera, excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: I am a novice photographer and this camera works very well for me to learn with as it has both manual (which I am learning) and automatic settings. Customer service was awesome. The lens had a crusty mark on it and they sent me a lens cleaning kit immediately. Satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Loving it.
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm loving this camera. Way too much to learn but that's the price I'll pay for great quality pictures. As would be obvious, it's much heavier than my "put-in-my-pocket" point and shoot Canon Powershot so that's definitely something I'll have to get used to. The 55-300mm lens worked at very well at my daughter's school program yesterday and I can't wait to take better pictures this year than I did last year! I haven't used the 18-55mm lens yet so I can't comment on it but I suspect it will be just as good.
customer_reviews.author: A. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: So worth it
customer_reviews.text: Such an upgrade from my previous, entry-level DSLR. This camera is very user friendly and it arrived in great condition and very quickly! The camera is so versatile and easy to use, it's worth it for the price I got it for. Can't wait to use it for things like vlogging, tutorials, and photography.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Noejovich

customer_reviews.title: Not a US camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera several years back. It fell and i needed to have it serviced. Nikon repair would not touch it and said it was a grey market camera.
customer_reviews.author: LLW

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic D5300
customer_reviews.text: Set camera up per Ken Rockwell's recommendations and you will have a outstanding DSLR in this D5300. Liked it so much we bought another for my wife. Keep it up Nikon. This little jewel blows me away for the bang for the buck. Thanks again for helping me become a better photographer while staying in reasonable budget.
customer_reviews.author: KentuckyRifle

customer_reviews.title: Great camera kit
customer_reviews.text: Great camera kit. This is a wonderful starter to mid range DSLR camera. Nikon makes quality products and has good customer service and a good reputation. My mothers Nikkor and Nikon lens from the 1980s fit this camera. I use it mainly for shooting my kids sports events: baseball and tennis. I am able to take great action shots from the stands. Very glad I purchased it and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Still learning all the features but am very impressed. Much better images than any non-DSLR has provided. I bought a big Tamron lens for it, working well. I'm an amateur, but have already taken better pictures than any other format with this camera regarding focus, sharpness, contrast and resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Decided I needed an upgrade from my camera phone with our first child on the way. Extremely happy with this camera. Easy to use. Attractive design. Great picture quality. This is my first nice camera. My dad always used Nikon when I was growing up. Can’t wait to use this to capture all our special moments.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Riggs

customer_reviews.title: Would have gotten 5 stars but I actually like my D5100 better
customer_reviews.text: Would have gotten 5 stars but I actually like my D5100 better. The images (Using the same glass) appear sharper when taken with the D5100. Not much of an upgrade as I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: M. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Dependable, reliable seller & Great camera !
customer_reviews.text: Great camera - not too complicated but has lots of options. The seller is also really good because I needed a hard copy owners manual and they sent one along with a free 32 GB SDHC ! How awesome ! Speedy delivery of both the original order and the manual / SD card !
customer_reviews.author: L. Pegram

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera and have had absolutely no problems with ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera and have had absolutely no problems with it. Cant believe how long the battery last. Excellent purchase and I highly recommend this camera if you are just getting into photography.
customer_reviews.author: Mikerzer

customer_reviews.title: this is my first DSLR. So far I am ...
customer_reviews.text: this is my first DSLR. So far I am loving it. pros - rotatable display (not touch screen) - remotely u can take and share pictures - very handy to use - GPS and WiFi inbuilt so u don't have to buy external adapters cons - lack of touch screen - GPS drains out battery very quickly overall, it is a worth of price and cons doesn't contribute to quality of picture so we can neglect the cons.
customer_reviews.author: nandkishor

customer_reviews.title: Be warned not an authorized Nikon Dealer!
customer_reviews.text: The auto focus does not work on the camera and when we tried to use the Nikon 1 year warranty we were told that even though this camera was marketed as being “new” the seller is NOT and authorized dealer so we are not eligible for warranty coverage. Brand new camera doesn’t work and not eligible for warranty or return.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful camera!
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months of usage, I figured out that this is the best camera anyone can buy. Awesome quality and colour accuracy. My favourite feature is the WiFi file transfer. Just download the App and connect to any device instantly. Even the large size files can be transferred just in seconds. This masterpiece from Nikon beats out any other camera in this segment. I highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Lokesh Chebolu

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. Honestly
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Honestly, probably the best budget entry-level dslr I've come across so far. It hits all the stops in terms of what you need as an aspiring photographer/videographer. I love the fact that the screen comes out, making it much easier for me to get those cinematic shots without struggling to see what I'm looking at. The price is insane for the quality you get and I would say that this is the kind of camera that will last you a long time before you'll feel the need to upgrade. You'll get your money's worth whether you're planning to use this for productivity or just simple auto-focus photos for your family/events/etc.
customer_reviews.author: Arjay

customer_reviews.title: Much more than what i espect
customer_reviews.text: This is my first dsrl camera. I did a lot of research. This camera has the best value for the money for me. More than awesome pictures. Incredible quality. Is super easy to understand. One of my biggest selling points was the wi-fi. Just activate it connect it with your smart phone and choose the pictures you want to download to your phone as previews. In less than 5 min you can upload to any social media. It works great on vacations. You can post everithing 2 min after you take the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Amezcua

customer_reviews.title: Happy!
customer_reviews.text: I’m new to digital SLRs, but this camera (Nikon d5300) is exactly what I need! Great images, great features, and easily adapts for astrophotography-CMOS displays low noise. Extremely happy with suppliers shipment and product.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Dzen

customer_reviews.title: ... from a mediocre point and shoot to a relatively nice DSLR. I wanted a camera that could take ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to go from a mediocre point and shoot to a relatively nice DSLR. I wanted a camera that could take the kind of photos I can imagine but couldn't execute with my old camera. So far, it has delivered. It's crazy how you can see a photo taken with a point and shoot, and see the same thing taken with this camera, and it immediately looks professional. Also, the quick adjust buttons for the manual settings are handy.
customer_reviews.author: Daedalus1080

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera close to prosumer quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Was replacing my lost D5300 and concidered going to newer entry level models, but after doing research still comeback to this model. Excellent model for your money. Great camera to have!
customer_reviews.author: Keith H. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Great camera competitive price
customer_reviews.text: I know nothing about taking pictures. My son gave me like 5 minutes of instruction and I am shooting in manual mode with excellent results. Love the viewfinder and find the controls straight forward. Comes with a DVD to help you figure things out in case you don't have an adult son to clue you in. I haven't watched the DVD and cannot say how informative that might be.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: This camera was advertised as having a GPS feature. After several calls to Nikon I was still unable to activate the GPS. I’m quite certain this camera was manufactured for the Chinese market and China does not allow GPS. This camera was misrepresented on Amazon. It may not even be under warranty in the US. It still is a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Soechtig

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy an open box for a high value item. It's been six months since I purchased this camera. It's been doing an awesome job just like the reviews said. Packaging was great. Great investment! Item still in great shape!
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting more scratches but works perfectly and like brand new! Some reviews says it didn't come with a camera strap but mine did and everything it said in the explanation.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Kao

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my wife and what I get is not acceptable at all. The package arrived with missing tutorial book and a lens. And top of all of this I got non brand case instead the original one as listed on the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mjouni

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great camera with a lot of features. I just don't know how to apply them.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than a month
customer_reviews.text: The shutter broke after very minimal use, and it’s not covered under Nikon warranty because it was purchased on amazon. Safer to just purchase this at Best Buy or any supplier that provides a year of warranty
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: better to buy a smartphone with a good camera I did not feel the quality of the image that the seller claims This technique was current 7-10 years ago nobody needs it today From the positive, I can only note that it normally keeps charging and the body is not bad
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Black speck in view finder
customer_reviews.text: Just took out this camera for my vacation. When we arrived at the ocean, I went to take a picture(should have check the camera before I went on my trip) theres a black spec in the view finder that wont come out. Please contact me. This is a big speck thay makes the view finder irritating to use!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. it has multiple settings that all result in crystal clear images.... the photo quality is so high that facebook can not handle the pixel count and will lower the grade of your photo to be able to post it. sturdy built and lenses are plentiful as it is a Nikon brand
customer_reviews.author: jonmiller1441

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding mid-range DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I traded in my Nikon D5100 for the newer D5300 and have been nothing but pleased. The greater flexibility that 24.2 MP provides along with significantly more focus points are the significant changes from my D5100. But I also appreciate the GPS and WiFi capability. For the amateur who wants to take excellent, reproducible shots, this is an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D5300
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera based on all the great reviews and couldn't be happier! Extreme Electronic delivered fast!
customer_reviews.author: John Crowley

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the photos are amazing. I would consider my self to be somewhat ...
customer_reviews.text: Such a major upgrade from my superzoom. The quality of the photos are amazing. I would consider my self to be somewhat of an advanced photographer, and I bought this camera for many reasons. One of which was to capture photos my old camera could not. So needless to say right out of the box I went for advanced features that are taking some time to learn. But buy the third day i could find buttons and take the shot I wanted.(with great results) The HI ISO shots look great! I would recomend a book on this camera to go with it as the manual is sparse. All in all I love this camera!
customer_reviews.author: joe witherspoon

customer_reviews.title: Defective After 18 Months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in February 2019. It no longer works. None of the control buttons are functioning.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great quality pics!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera!! Easy to use (although I am still learning all the features) and takes amazing quality photos!
customer_reviews.author: Nesting Niche

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It is a great camera I’m so excited to upgrade. I can’t wait to take pictures of my new grandson
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HAPPY CAMPER!
customer_reviews.text: She's a honey! Maybe I should have sprung for some sort of mirrorless interchangeable lens camera, but I'm an old guy that started in the 1970s with a Nikon F (prism, no meter!) and this baby fits the bill... complex, but hey, you can shoot manual (if you know light, f stop and shutter speed) or get lazy and use "AUTO." You pays yer money and takes yer choice. Got the 18~200 VR ED zoom... what FUN!
customer_reviews.author: John Wade Long Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Like a Nikon.
customer_reviews.text: Great Product, got it on time and there is nothing like a Nikon... Great first professional camera.
customer_reviews.author: Lazaro

customer_reviews.title: Shipping was not good. But the price and quality of the camera ...
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was not good. But the price and quality of the camera are amazing. This was an upgrade from my D80. I bought this camera body and a sigma 2.8 lens. I can now take amazing indoor and night time photos without a flash or blur. This camera makes flawless photo's so much easier to accomplish. I love this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: The Nikon D5300 takes nice and clear photos whether the subject is moving or ...
customer_reviews.text: I take mainly nature shots of birds and eagles. Have a Nikkor AF DX 55-300 lens attached. The Nikon D5300 takes nice and clear photos whether the subject is moving or not.
customer_reviews.author: r326

customer_reviews.title: Great camera! Takes beautiful pictures and is very easy ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! Takes beautiful pictures and is very easy to use. I felt like a needed an advanced college degree for my last DSLR. I like that I can take remote photos through the phone app and also instantly send photos to my phone to share through the wifi. Lots of fun quick fun filter options as well.
customer_reviews.author: MAC

customer_reviews.title: She Absolutely Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: I returned this camera only because it arrived in an opened box.This was so annoying, considering the fact that this was a birthday gift for my wife. We ended up ordering another D5300 that arrived in an unopened box. As for the camera, it's a vast improvement over the D40x I purchased for her ten years ago. Bottom line; she absolutely loves it.
customer_reviews.author: ELLIOTT G.

customer_reviews.title: Good pictures.
customer_reviews.text: Works well and is much better than a phone picture.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Best Nikon SLR camera without paying a lot
customer_reviews.text: Best Nikon SLR camera without paying a lot. It's as good as the wonderful Nikon D3300, but adds built-in wi-fi and gps along with an articulated screen for high or low shots. If you can afford the extra money, this may be your bet.
customer_reviews.author: random thoughts

customer_reviews.title: GPS works well.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for its GPS capability. Has worked well in various weather conditions. Camera is an older model but has lots of bells and whistles.
customer_reviews.author: HY

customer_reviews.title: Great camera and amazing lens
customer_reviews.text: Feels nice in the hand and the 39 point auto focus works really well! Was worried before my purchase due to the GPS-problems. After downloading A-GPS data it works fine for me outdoors, but inside it still doesn't get reception, so use my iPhone for coordinate and add the GPS-metadata from the iPhone in Lightroom instead. This is my first DSLR (have previous experience with D300) and I am not disappointed by this purchase. :)
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Lund Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Restocking fee!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing bad to say about the product however.... beware that I was charge $60 for a restocking fee. I thought a restocking fee would not apply if everything was in original package but that is not the case!!!! Abes electronics.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Durbin

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from a European tour where I took over 900 photos and videos. I only got the camera a few days before the trip, so I really didn't get much time to learn all the new features. I am looking forward to doing more annotation of my photos with GPS and audio notes. It was a refurbished unit and looked brand new. So for so good!!
customer_reviews.author: rancher

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera, it takes crisp clean photos and the colors are pretty good. The only somewhat annoying issue is that when using the live view mode it really slows down the speed of the camera. Also in live mode you lose a lot of manual settings like focal points settings.
customer_reviews.author: Nurse 727

customer_reviews.title: I haven't really used this camera much yet and am ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't really used this camera much yet and am trying to familiarize myself with the wifi. For an open box item, I found no problem as yet. Even the scratch mentioned on packing list is unnoticeable. I wouldn't have seen this, if they didn't inform me.
customer_reviews.author: Jose R.

customer_reviews.title: As I imagined, excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera with a easy to use interface. The arrangement of the buttons, like all Nikons, make its operation easier. I chose the option of a more affordable 18-55mm AF-P solo lens, its autofocus is fluid and it does not make noise, perfect for taking video. Stable and fast Wi-Fi during photo transfers to a smartphone. Up to now, I have not found any flaws. I am satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Santos

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Get this camera with the better 18MM-140MM lens. That lens new is 500 bucks. This package was 689. Love the camera, perfect inbetween intro camera.
customer_reviews.author: J. Love

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a D5000 and am really happy with this camera. The screen is a lot bigger and clearer, and the photos show up on the screen a lot faster ( there was a delay with the D5000). The screen is bright and a lot more modern and upgraded. All of my lenses and flashes work. Its also lightweight. I would recommend this camera!
customer_reviews.author: MDC

customer_reviews.title: I’m hot af on this camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera clear pictures great features I’d say buy the Bluetooth version though
customer_reviews.author: Tim Orona

customer_reviews.title: GREAT camera at this price
customer_reviews.text: GREAT camera at this price. Solid features and amazing image quality. Just like with most of these cameras, there are more features than i know what to do with... but i am having fun trying them out. And sturdy too... i dropped it on hard wood as i was first removing it from the box. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: JB

product_meta.title: Nikon D5300 24.2 MP CMOS Digital SLR Camera with Built-in Wi-Fi and GPS Body Only (Red)
product_meta.description:
Color:Red| Style:Body Only| Configuration:BaseDazzling image quality meets modern connectivity with built-in Wi-Fi for instant photo sharing and remote camera control and built-in GPS with mapping for geotagging and tracking your adventures. An innovative new 24.2-megapixel image sensor captures the purest, most lifelike photos and 1080p Full HD videos imaginable, and a brilliant 3.2-inch swiveling Vari-angle display delivers beautiful views from any angle--all in a compact, sleek design.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 


Dazzling image quality meets modern connectivity with built-in Wi-Fi® for instant photo sharing and remote camera control and built-in GPS with mapping for geotagging and tracking your adventures. An innovative new 24.2-megapixel image sensor captures the purest, most lifelike photos and 1080p Full HD videos imaginable, and a brilliant 3.2-inch swiveling Vari-angle display delivers beautiful views from any angle—all in a compact, sleek design. 

CAPTURE AND INSTANTLY SHARE THE MOST VIBRANT, LIFELIKE IMAGES OF YOUR LIFE.
Meet the first in an exciting new generation of Wi-Fi® enabled, ultra-high-resolution Nikon HD-SLRs: the D5300. With built-in Wi-Fi for instant photo sharing to your smartphone or tablet, GPS and mapping, a cutting edge 24.2-megapixel image sensor, an extra-large swiveling Vari-angle LCD and more, D5300 brings an outstanding new level of image quality and capabilities in a compact, ergonomic design. Pair it with any NIKKOR lens—like the outstanding AF-S DX NIKKOR 18-140mm f/3.5-5.6G ED VR kit lens—and unleash the full potential of its innovative image sensor. Every photo will be richer, truer to life than most photos you've seen. Every HD video will have a stunning cinematic look, a level of sharpness and clarity that ignites on ultra-high-resolution tablets, laptops and TVs. And the first time you use your smartphone or tablet to instantly share photos from the D5300, you'll realize the game has truly changed.



YOUR LIFE IN BREATHTAKING CLARITY
A NEW LEVEL OF IMAGE QUALITY
The sharpness, clarity and richness of colors in the D5300's photos and Full HD videos is nothing short of astounding. A recent design innovation allows the D5300's 24.2-megapixel DX format CMOS image sensor* to capture the purest, most lifelike images possible. Enlarge or crop your photos without losing any sharpness or detail—a feat not possible with most smartphones and lesser cameras. Pair that capability with any exceptional NIKKOR lens, marvels of clarity and sharpness in their own right, and you'll experience the image quality your memories deserve.

*Exquisite detail reproduction realized by an image sensor unit designed without an optical low-pass filter.

SHARE EVERY STUNNING IMAGE, INSTANTLY
A NEW LEVEL OF CONNECTIVITY
With built-in Wi-Fi and GPS, the D5300 is the first in an exciting new generation of connected Nikon D-SLRs. Wirelessly connect to D5300 with your smartphone or tablet,* then browse the photos on D5300's memory card, import your favorites and instantly email them, text them or post them online. While connected, your smart device can also act as a remote monitor for the D5300. See what the camera sees and even fire the shutter—perfect for group shots and self portraits! When travelling, built-in GPS geotags all of your shots. Create exciting travel journals, find nearby Points of Interest and easily share your location data when posting photos on Facebook or Flickr.

TAKE IT ON EVERY OUTING
COMPACT, LIGHTWEIGHT, RUGGED AND COMFORTABLE
Don't let the small size of the D5300 fool you—it delivers big-camera quality and capabilities. Like all Nikon D-SLRs, the D5300 was designed for ergonomics—every button and dial was carefully placed for comfortable, efficient operation. Yet it's big in all the right places, like its 3.2-inch swiveling Vari-angle LCD and its 24.2-megapixel DX-format CMOS image sensor. You'll take the D5300 on every adventure, which means you'll bring home more stunning views of your travels.





SHOOT FROM ANY ANGLE
EXTRA-LARGE SWIVELING VARI-ANGLE DISPLAY
The D5300's extra-large ultra-high resolution Vari-angle LCD swivels 180° so you can shoot from exciting new angles. Hold the camera overhead for great shots over a crowd. Hold the camera down low for a fun face-to-face perspective of your pet. And create some of your best selfies yet—frame a stunning new profile pic, then upload it right to web, thanks to Wi-Fi connectivity!*

FOCUS EXACTLY WHERE YOU WANT IT
Whether shooting stationary subjects, candid photos, high-speed action or Full HD video, the D5300 keeps everything in focus. Its 39-point high-density autofocus system with 9 cross-type sensors quickly locks onto your subject, and Nikon's unique 3D-tracking uses the 2,016-pixel RGB sensor to recognize and follow it across the frame.

CATCH EXACTLY THE RIGHT MOMENT
When photo-worthy action starts, hold down the shutter button and capture every movement, expression and feeling at 5 frames per second, even when using the Vari-angle LCD. Stop reaching for your smartphone when an important moment happens—except to share the great shot you just caught with the D5300.

STORYTELLING AT YOUR FINGERTIPS
Bring all the image quality the D5300 produces—softly blurred backgrounds, tack-sharp details, vibrant colors—to dazzling 1080p Full HD videos. In Live View, Nikon's full-time autofocus follows your subject and keeps it sharp. A built-in stereo microphone adds high-fidelity sound to your videos, or you can add Nikon's optional accessory ME-1 stereo microphone for the highest quality sound possible.







SUPPLIED ACCESSORIES
 * EN-EL14a Rechargeable Li-ion Battery
 * MH-24 Quick Charger
 * DK-25 Rubber Eyecup
 * EG-CP16 Audio Video Cable
 * AN-DC3 Strap (Black)
 * AN-DC3 Strap (Red)
 * AN-DC3 Strap (Grey)
 * DK-5 Eyepiece Cap
 * BF-1B Body Cap
 * BS-1 Accessory Shoe Cap
 * ViewNX 2
feature_bullets: 24MP DX-format CMOS sensor with no optical low-pass filter
39-point AF system with 3D tracking and 3D matrix metering II
Built-in Wi-Fi (for sharing and remote camera control) and GPS

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars850 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
